name: Begonia amphioxus
description: Begonia amphioxus is a terrestrial plant native to tropical regions of Borneo, particularly Sarawak, Malaysia. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and features upright stems (15-30 cm tall) with small, dramatic, asymmetrical, dark green to black leaves with distinctive red spots and markings, perfect for compact spaces. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Leaves often feature striking patterns including spirals, spots, stripes, and iridescent sheens, with some species having translucent "windows" in their leaves. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive spotted foliage. It's extremely popular among Begonia enthusiasts for its unique coloration.
careTips: Keep soil moist but not soggy
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
